assignedRoom.roomDescription:
This is cockpit 
Flight check. 
 Check the coordinates OR set journey destination. 
 Check the coordinates - check the coordinates card while not showing it to the other players and then put it back.You don't have to tell what you saw. 
 Move journey destination marker to selected infield. 
Attention! You cannot change journey destination if there are any characters already in hibernation process. 
You should remember checked coordinates. 
You cannot set journey destination if there are any Nemesis in the cockpit. 
Attention! At the end of the game, if spaceship has not been destroyed, coordinates card should be revealedJourney destination marker determines final destination among the 4 possible coordinates. 
Attention! In this room, Search action is not available.

This is fire control center 
Initiate the fire control procedure 
 Choose any room.
Remove the fire token from that room (if there is one). 
 All intruders flee from that room (in random directions determined by drawing Event cards – 1 card per intruder). 
Tip: You can use the fire control procedure even if there is no fire in the chosen room, in order to drive away intruders located there.

This is storage 
Search for an Item 
Draw 2 cards from the item deck of any color (red, yellow, or blue).

This is decontamination room 
Perform the Decontamination Procedure 
 Scan all Contamination cards (from your hand, action deck, and discard pile). Remove all INFECTED cards. 
If there is a Larva on your character qboard, remove it. 
 After scanning, your character suffers 1 Light Wound and you automatically pass. Shuffle all your Action cards (including those in hand and in the discard pile) and form a new Action deck. 
Note: After the decontamination procedure, you must always pass. Your hand remains empty until the start of the next round.

This is generator room 
Start/Stop the Ship's Self - Destruct Countdown 
 Place 1 status marker on the 1st (green) space of the self-destruct track, if there is no marker there. 
From now on, each time you move the time marker on the time track, also move the self-destruct marker 1 space forward. 
If a character stops the self-destruct countdown, remove the marker from the track. (It will return to the 1st green space when the countdown is reinitiated.) 
When the marker reaches the 1st yellow space on the self-destruct track, the countdown can no longer be stopped. All escape pods automatically open (but can still be closed). 
When the marker reaches the last space on the track (with the skull symbol), the ship explodes. 
Note: The self-destruct countdown cannot be started if any character is already hibernated. 
If jump takes place while the self-destruct countdown is active, the ship explodes.

This is engine control room 
Check Engine Status 
You may check the status of 3 Engines. 
 You can check the status of an engine even if there is a malfunction marker in its Engine Room. 
 You cannot change engine status from the Engine Control Room.

Those are showers 
Take a shower 
If you have a Slime marker on your character qboard, discard it. 
 Additionally, you may scan all Contamination cards in your hand and remove all UNINFECTED cards. 
 If at least one of the scanned cards is INFECTED, place a Larva on your character qboard (do not remove the INFECTED card!). 
 If you already have a Larva figure on your qboard, your character dies. In that case, place 1 Creeper in this room.

This is armory 
Charge your energetic weapon. 
 Add 2 cartridges to one of your energetic weapon. 
 Attention! This room doesn't allow to charge classical weapon. 
 Attention! Cartridge marker count on weapon's card cannot exceed maximum magazine capacity

This is communication room 
Send a signal. 
 Put status marker on Set signal section of your qboard. 
 Sending a signal is a requirement for some of the objective cards and doesn't have any other use in the game.

This is treatment room 
Heal your wounds. 
Bandage all of your severe injuries OR heal one bandaged severe injury OR bandage all of your shallow injuries

This is hibernatorium 
Attempt Hibernation. 
 You can only perform this action if the hibernation pods are unlocked – the marker on the time track must be on a blue space. 
 Make a Ripple roll. If any Nemesis appears in the room, your attempt to enter the hibernation pod has failed. 
 If no Nemesis appears in the room, remove your character’s miniature from the game – you have successfully entered hibernation. You cannot change the ship’s destination or start the self-destruct sequence if any character is in hibernation. 
 You cannot enter a hibernation pod if there is a Nemesis in the Hibernatorium. 
Note! You cannot perform the "Search" action in this room. 
Note! The onboard computer is programmed to protect hibernated crew members and prevent any actions that might endanger their lives.

This is slime covered room 
You've been slimmed!
When you enter this room, you automatically gain a Slime marker.

This is pods control room 
Close/Open 1 Escape Pod 
Flip 1 Escape Pod token to its closed or open side.

This is airlock 
Initiate airlock activation procedure 
Choose 1 any other yellow room. There must be no destroyed doors in the corridors leading to that room. 
 Automatically close the doors in all corridors leading to the selected room. 
 Place an airlock marker in that room to indicate it is under a special procedure. If any door in the corridors leading to this room is opened before the end of the current player phase, remove the marker. 
If at the end of the current player phase (when all players have already passed) all doors in the corridors leading to this room are closed, everyone in the room dies immediately (both characters and intruders). Then remove the token. 
.If there was a fire marker in the room, remove it.
Bodies, intruder corpses, and dropped items remain in the room.

This is command center 
Open/Close Doors 
You may choose 1 room and open or close any doors in the corridors leading to that room. 
 You can decide which doors to open and which to close — you don’t have to open or close all of them.

This is evacuation sector 
Try to access emergency capsule. 
You can only attempt this action if any of sector's capsule is opened and has at least one available slot. 
 Make a Ripple roll. If any Nemesis appears in room, your attempt will fail. 
 After Ripple roll examination, if no Nemesis appears, you can put your character in one of opened capsules in sector, if at least one empty slot is available. 
Each capsule contains two slots, therefore it can accommodate up to two characters. 
Check "Emergency capsules" frame at the end of this chapter to obtain information what happens once character enters emergency capsule. 
Character cannot enter emergency capsule if any Nemesis is present in the room.

This is nest 
Take 1 Egg 
Take 1 egg from the Intruder qboard, then perform a noise roll. 
The eggs on the Intruder qboard represent the eggs located in the Nest. When a player takes (or destroys) an egg from the Nest, it is removed from the Intruder qboard. 
 Taking an egg from the Intruder qboard costs 2 actions, while picking up an egg token from the main qboard costs only 1 action. 
When there are no eggs left in the Nest (all have been taken or destroyed), the Nest is considered destroyed. 
Place 1 damage marker on the Nest tile – this symbolizes its destruction. 
If there are eggs in a room on fire and no character is carrying them, destroy one of those eggs during the Event Phase, in the Fire Damage step. 
Note! Remember that an egg is a Heavy Object. 
Note! You cannot perform a Search action in the Nest. 
Destroy 1 Egg 
 When your character is in a room that contains eggs not being carried by anyone, you may attempt to destroy them. Eggs can be destroyed using a Shooting or Melee action. Each point of damage (of any type) destroys 1 egg. 
If the character misses during a melee attack, they do not draw a Contamination card or suffer a Serious Wound. 
You can also throw a grenade into a room containing uncarried eggs, just like when intruders are present in the room. A grenade destroys 2 eggs. A Molotov cocktail destroys 1 egg. 
After each individual attempt to destroy an egg, you must perform a Noise roll.

This is laboratory 
Examine 1 Object 
This action can only be performed if the room contains (even if carried by a character) one of the following objects: a crew member’s body, an intruder carcass, or an intruder egg. 
 Reveal 1 intruder weakness card related to the object. 
The object is not discarded after the examination is completed. However, the player may drop it without spending an action.

This is engine room 
Check the engine 
Check engine status in this engine room - look up the top engine token while not showing it to the other players. You don't have to tell the truth about it's status to other players. 
 The top engine token shows the current status of the engine. 
 Fix/Damage engine 
 You can make action Repair/Damage on the engine in this room (using action card "Repairs" or "Tools" tool card): take both engine status tokens, check their values (do not inform other players about those values) and put them back in order chosen by yourself. 
You don't have to tell the truth about if you have fixed the engine but you need to tell whether you have changed tokens order. 
 You can repair/damage an engine even if there is a malfunction marker in the room, and even if you haven’t previously checked the engine status. 
Note! The ship has 3 engines, of which at least 2 must be functional in order to safely return to Earth. At the beginning of the game, players do not know which engines are working. 
Players can check the status of a given engine during the game – for example, here, in the appropriate Engine Room. At the end of the game, if the ship has not been destroyed earlier, all top engine tokens must be revealed to determine whether the ship exploded during the hyperspace jump attempt. 
Note! You cannot perform the "Search" action in this room.
